host_about:
Bonjour, Hello, Hola, I’m Cam. 

A passionate traveller and entrepreneur, I’m originally from France and now living between Canada, Mexico and France with my wife and two beautiful daughters.

I enjoy meeting new people and exploring new cultures. I’ve been to Thailand, Myanmar, Indonesia, Spain, Italy, Greece, Belgium, Portugal, Sweden, Finland, UK, Holland, Switzerland, Caraibian, Hong Kong, Australia, USA, Mexico…and there’s more on the bucket list.

I’m happiest when I’m outside; swimming, kiteboarding, running, hiking, wakeboarding and snowboarding. I’m also a big fan of design and architecture.

I was one of the earliest members of AirBnB (2009) and the first person to rent a house-boat 

My philosophy? Dream your life and live your dream!

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions,

Cheers!

Hello! We are Mai and Tan. We have been residents of Vancouver for over 38 years and have met so many travelers in our time here. Our motto is comfort and convenience, at an affordable price. We spend our time making sure that each house is cleaned on a daily basis. If there's any questions or concerns, Mai is only a phone call away.

As avid Airbnbers we've stayed in countless vacation rentals and have experienced first hand what works and what doesn't when it comes to comfortable, well thought out accommodations.

Our goal, and what we work hard to accomplish,  is to ensure you have an excellent guest experience during your stay!

A grandmother who visits her children who are spread over two continents while she rents out her home.  Going to celebrate my eightieth birthday with my children and their families on the East Coast this August.
Canadian who lives between Japan  & Canada. Married with two boys and a big black dog.
I will be happy to host you.

Hi there!

I came to Vancouver 20 years ago and never left!  I have travelled in many parts of the world and decided to settle here in BC as many do.  I love Airbnb and have stayed in many of them including in Dublin, Sydney and many parts of New Zealand to experience the culture and stay in a home away from home.
I will try to accomodate you as much as I can in hopes you can feel at home when travelling here to the beautiful West Coast.

Vancouver born and raised. Lover of the mountains and the ocean which makes Vancouver the perfect place to call home. Easy going, lover of meat a cheese and often can be found with my feet up relaxing.
I have live in Vancouver for 40 years.  Please ask me any questions about Vancouver.

I live in the beautiful city of Vancouver on the west coast of Canada. I am a communications professional, mother to two girls - six years old and 11 years old -  wife to a weekend warrior on two wheels, a passionate supporter of organ donation and an avid traveler. We have been enjoying some of the incredible sights around our British Columbia backyard during the pandemic.

We are a family who love to travel in comfort and enjoy the ethos and community spirit of AirBNB. We also host on AirBNB with a suite of our own for travelers to enjoy in Vancouver!
Bon Voyage !!

We are a young family who love to travel to visit our friends and family that seem to be all over the world. 
We are easy going, and really hope that our guests have a great stay and enjoy our home as much as we do. We have done our best to create a cozy, intimate space that is unique and inviting. And our 5 year old daughter loves company!
I am from Vancouver and in my free time enjoy Yoga, exploring the neighborhoods of my hometown , travel, and antique hunting to name  a few :-)

We are very well travel couple that we like to hosting  and welcome guest from different countries. Also we use Airbnb for ours family and personally vacation . Please be in contact we us for any information that we happy yo answer .

Hello! My husband Fred and I are actors living in central Vancouver.  We pride ourselves on hosting by the golden rule - create a space that we ourselves would love to visit. A clean, warm, inviting place that you can truly call home away from home. We look forward to greeting you and hosting your stay. The apartment will have everything you will need including a large well equipped kitchen. I am also a cook book writer. Thus the well equipped kitchen!  We ask that guests tell us a bit about themselves before we accept a booking. Things like: general ages and number of guests, where they are from, purpose of the trip etc.

The earth is but one country!
I love travelling and meeting people from all countries and cultures.

We moved into this central Vancouver location 2005.  We were the first residential applicant of Vancouver's eco-density initiative in our area that allowed laneway houses to be built on a regular sized city lot.  We built our laneway house by late 2009 and since then have seen our neighborhood blossom with countless young families.  We feel right at home with the large old oak trees, field, playground and tarmack 100m down the road, and friends walking by throughout the day.  We value community, can't live without the outdoors and being active, film, music, friends, making things and solving problems.

We welcome people travelling to Vancouver whether it be to explore the city, relocate, visit family or enjoy the wondrous outdoors our city is centred in.  It is a highlight for us to meet people adventuring from all across the world, who find a home in our space for their time in our beautiful city.

Craftsman/designer, Public Health Nurse and Educator by trade, we find our two young boys and puppy keep us busy and engaged.  We believe in the principle of kaizen, slow and constant change toward improvement.  We find joy in beautiful, simple and sustainable and our space reflects that.

Hi! Thanks for visiting my page... I'm a mother, and a health and wellness coach, living and working in this beautiful city.  I love design, architecture, and cooking great food.  I travel a lot, and can't stand boring hotels -- so my suites are outfitted to be what I look for: a perfect home away from home. I truly love the neighbourhood of Strathcona and hope that you will too!
Architect living in Vancouver for over 40 years. Love to travel and excited to welcome travellers to my home town.
Enjoys: skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking, swimming, tennis , fishing and spending time with my family participating in these activities.
Owner of a number of businesses in Vancouver, Canada, including rental business

I am a property manager. I run residential rentals and Vacation Rentals as well. 
I make sure my place is clean, and bed & linen are always wash and clean after guest check out. I make sure my guests are happy when they check-in and check-out as well.

5 things that I can't live without; 
1) Clean bathroom
2) Clean bed & linens
3) Blanket for my feet :-) 
4) healthy  food & clean water 
5) Smart phone

I love travelling and I am my happiest at a festival/concert. I work in Science, ski, play tennis, softball and recently ran my first half marathon. I was born in England, but have lived in Vancouver for 18 years now.
I'm a business owner in Vancouver. I'm housesitting and renting out my primary apartment. I'm happy to give you some pointers on the city, so feel free to ask.

Easy going - and proud to share our house and our city.  Good coffee usually on in the morning - NEW!  Breakfast available - either as self serve in the loft, or come down and enjoy what we have available.   We are surrounded by boutique coffee shops and craft breweries!  imagine that.    I know the city well - so am happy to make suggestions on where to go, what to do, local festivals, events, etc.  Its good karma right?  I trail run in the mountains, hike, jog, ski, bike, crossfit, pilates, yoga,etc.  You are more than invited to come along.  I'm also a hash house harrier - so you can join me on our weekly runs if you like.  Do as much or as little - its your show.
Have a super day!

Hi Dear Guests. House i is a company operating accommodation.  Our staff Cheryl, James,Thelma and Taty will be here to serve you.  House i is centrally located in downtown Vancouver and our goal is to provide a professional cleaning standard accommodation rather than a family oriented accommodation.  If you are looking for a convenient location, nice and clean accommodation at a reasonable price,  we will be your best choice.  

Look forward to seeing you soon.

House i Staff

In my spare time I am pretty active - currently with beach volleyball, hiking, orienteering, swing dancing, and rock-climbing.

I also enjoy travelling, reading, foreign films, and intelligent conversation about pretty much anything.

I am often busy after work so may not see much of you, but would be happy to invite you along to some of the outdoor activities that I am doing if you are keen on hiking or other outdoor activities.

We - Alexis and Sylvain - are professional dance artists. Alexis is a dancer working for Ballet BC and Sylvain is a freelance Ballet Master, Rehearsal Director and also a photographer. We are passionate for our commitment to working in the arts and we want to reflect that in our home. Our intention is to create a welcoming and restful environment and we love to share it with our guests.
We like snowboarding, eating on the deck,  watching tv.
I work in the cell phone industry and have travelled to many countries around the world.  I enjoy meeting people from different cultures and welcome you as our guest.

We like to meet new people and see new places and we love road trips. We are vegetarians but our daughter is a carnivore.  We like good food,good friends and good movies, so we enjoy spending time at home when we can.

We live in the upstairs suite and we enjoy meeting our guests and helping you get to know our city.  

As with any vacation rental property, we respect your privacy by leaving you alone unless you need us (to answer questions, etc.).  

Enjoy your stay!

Welcome to Vancouver!
This is Saligooli :-)

Welcome to my Airbnb site. I am a  local resident for almost 30 years who is passionate about health and nature. I love hiking in the woods, gardening and cooking. This home will give any opportunity to walk in the woods right off your doors steps. I look forward to hosting you all. Warmest Regards.

I work from home since 2011, as a website designer and painter.
My great passions are painting, biking, swimming in the lakes.
I am super fortunate to live minutes from the greatest bike routes.
Hard to list my Favourite books, but I definitely love books with unexpected twists or books with new ideas: 
Mr. Sammler's Planet, Saul Bellow
Netochka Nezvanova,  Fyodor Dostoevsky
Plato Not Prozac, Lou Marinoff
My Name Is Red, Orhan Pamuk
The Bridge on the Drina, Ivo Andric
The Critique of Pure Reason, Immanuel Kant
When I travel it is to experience real life, languages and people in other countries. I love Greece, Belgrade and Paris, because I love painting, swimming in the warm Aegean sea and great and affordable theatre performances in Belgrade.
My husband prefers all inclusive arrangements, but I try to avoid these artificial environments and create my own itinerary.

Hello! I’m delighted to welcome people from all parts of the world to stay.  I'm very friendly, respectful, helpful and sociable.  I'd love to have you stay and provide you a comfortable, clean and safe stay while sharing with you as much information about Vancouver as possible. I look forward to making my place your home away from home!

Hello! I’m delighted to welcome people from all parts of the world to stay.  I'm very friendly, respectful, helpful and sociable.  I'd love to have you stay and provide you a comfortable, clean and safe stay while sharing with you as much information about Vancouver as possible. I look forward to making my place your home away from home!

I have travelled all over the world, and finally decided to make Vancouver + Canada my chosen home.
 I TRULY LOVE THIS CITY ...... its natural beauty, the beaches, the mountains, the tree-lined streets, the interesting neighbourhoods, like  CAMBIE VILLAGE,  COMMERCIAL DRIVE,  MAIN STREET,  KITSILANO,  the old fishing village of STEVESTON,  etc..  
The city + ocean walks, the cultural offerings, the great restaurants for all tastes + budgets with cuisine from all over the world, the cafes with live music, the spirit of the 'sharing economy', the beautiful parks, like QUEEN ELIZABETH PARK + STANLEY PARK, and many smaller community parks,  the BLOEDEL Conservatory,  VAN DUSEN GARDENS,  the LYNN CANYON SUSPENSION BRIDGE,  the VANCOUVER ART GALLERY, the MUSEUM of ANTHROPOLOGY at the UBC campus, etc., etc., ........ 
and I would be happy to introduce visitors to its many different aspects, and answer any questions you may have.

I truly enjoy helping fellow travellers feel at home by providing 
comfortable surroundings, a relaxed, easy-going atmosphere, 
and help with TRAVEL INFO + SUGGESTIONS of THINGS TO SEE + DO, 
with FINDING PERMANENT HOUSING  in Vancouver, if you are new to the CITY and/or the COUNTRY, and if you plan to GET SETTLED here  ........
plus answering your QUESTIONS + fulfill reasonable REQUESTS to the best of my ability.

Besides travelling all over the world, and my passion for Canada, for Vancouver, Vancouver Island, the Sunshine Coast + other areas of British Columbia, some of my other interests are: 

Neuroscience, depression research + treatment (especially the newer theories), as well as other treatment-resistant health conditions that science + medicine do not yet have good answers for, 
brain research, psychology, neurology, evidence-based medicine, injury recovery, concussion recovery //

Healthy nutrition without being too dogmatic about it //
Photography, architecture, design + industrial design, beautiful things //

Entrepreneurship + philanthropy, the 'Sharing Economy', ' (Website hidden by Airbnb) treating each other with kindness + respect,  interesting + novel ways of creating a good, meaningful life as well as a good income by thinking outside of the box // 

Reading, biographies, novels, short stories, science, history, politics, great TV shows + films, geography, 
different musical styles ...... especially songs with interesting, intelligent lyrics one can actually understand, 
great writing + intelligent conversation, small dinners with good friends (old + new) //

Downhill skiing, ocean kayaking, canoeing, bicycling, swimming (ideally in tropical waters), other forms of physical activities, like walks with great views on beaches, rocky headlands, most islands (tropical + otherwise), houses with ocean views ...... and probably a few more things that I can't think of right now ...... but this list should give you a pretty good idea of what constitutes a good day for me.

Thanks for reading this far :)

I'm a veteran of the US NAVY; served from 1971 - '73. For most of my time in New Orleans, I managed nightclubs in the French Quarter. Also, owned and operated a Personal Trainer business.
I've operated my travel business with AIRBNB since 2008.
I do my best to accommodate all my guests, respond to all inquiries as soon as possible, answer any and all questions, and provide them with the most accurate, up-to-date information about the resorts, and the surrounding areas.
And, I try to give the most economical rates.
Married couple in our forties from Vancouver Canada
Hi everyone!! I am a bay area native and I love to travel and meet new people.  I have enjoyed my experience so far with this site. I hope to hear from you :)

With a little help from my family, I run COMFYSUITES -  offering comfy, clean, convenient furnished apartment accommodations in Downtown Vancouver, in central locations to public transit, shopping, entertainment, and dining.

We enjoy sharing what we love in Vancouver and are happy to give tips on local favourites and things to do. 

We have had our share of amazing experiences traveling around the world and have met generous folks off the beaten path. So we can appreciate the sense of relief and comfort that comes with having a local help in a new place. We hope to share the same warm hospitality with our guests.

We are from Vancouver BC,We like to travel and meet new people!
I'm also a certified Yoga Teacher and you are welcome to take a private class with me.
We love to travel and see the world on an affordable budget...that's why we like to offer clean, comfortable and affordable accommodation for guests who wish to visit beautiful Vancouver.
Hello, I love to travel around the world and think AirBnB is great.

Integrated Media Artist. Work in web, film, audio, computer performance and dance. I am a native English speaker who is learning Bahasa Indonesia because I plan to travel to Indonesia.

I love hosting and traveling because I meet interesting people. Looking forward to meeting you!

Welcome! I am a chill, west coast gal. I am commercial pilot and love to travel so if my calendar shows an opening it means I am usually away somewhere. I've lived in many different cities, but Vancouver is most definitely my home and feel lucky to call it that. When at home I love walking on the seawall, or taking my bike around Stanley Park, going to yoga, or having a drink on a patio or enjoying a book in a coffee shop.

I was born in Vancouver, know a lot about the city, it's history and how to get around.  I should be able to answer most questions you might have, I hope to make your stay as convenient as possible.  Learning Spanish and I'm at a reading the newspaper level so far.

I am the executive director of the Vancouver Latin American Cultural Centre and have been hosting since 2010. I am a 20-time Superhost winner – even got a trophy from Airbnb! Please note that to comply with the City of Vancouver's bylaws, I only accept monthlong reservations.

I immigrated from Brazil to Vancouver in 2008 and now I'm also a Canadian citizen. Ken, my partner, is a musician and film critic.  As you can imagine, we watch more movies in one year than most people in their whole lives! I love cooking and baking with the great local products we find here.

I totally fell in love with Vancouver as soon as I got here, and I'm sure you will, too. (Or maybe you are returning for a visit and know exactly what I'm talking about!)

You will find a clean and comfortable apartment at the perfect location to explore the city, and I'll do my best to make your stay enjoyable and stress-free. 

I know how stressful planning a trip can be, so feel free to contact me with any questions.

I hope to see you soon!

I am an artist. I used to design and build costumes for theatre, film and TV but now I mainly make sculptural stuff and paint quite a bit but also do a little photography. My name is rare. If you look me up, you will find me fairly fast.

My husband Erez and I are fiftysomethings and have no kids but are fine with it if you do. We inherited 4 giant dogs from my dad who lived in the desert but are down to one since they were old guys when we got them. That sure changed our lives. I know I could never handle the responsibility of kids.


We split our time between California and Canada and can often be found on the I-5 in a big white cargo van  hauling many dog beds and dogs.

We are total podcast nerds and also like a good audiobook. We listened to The Life of Pi on one of our trips with the four dogs and felt very much like we were a boat full of critters that had to somehow learn how to travel together. 

Some podcasts we like are Benjamin Walker's Theory of Everything, 99% Invisible , Planet Money, Selected Shorts, This American Life, Radiolab, Future Tense, Science Friday, Wiretap, Singularity 1 on 1, Serial, Startup etc etc.

When we aren't listening to podcasts we can usually be found on reddit  so we are pretty quiet tenants.
When we travel it's important that there is a dog park nearby (if we have the vermin along) and otherwise, a solid internet connection is the only must.

The studio I'm listing here is my actual art studio but we also use it as a guest house. It used to be a garage. There is a bit of space to lay down fold out foamies as an additional bed but there isn't a living room area or a sofa. There also is not a kitchen but a kitchenette- only a two burner electric cooktop, coffee maker, coffee grinder, microwave, toaster oven,kettle,  apartment fridge and a giant restaurant sink (in case you need to dye anything while you are here ; ) There are various tools taking up space (eg: drafting table,industrial sewing machine) but there is a small table and a few office chairs. The main space is taken up with a very tall 8' x 4' work table. Anyone that wants to create stuff  is in luck. Just ask and I may be able to supply whatever tools or materials you need too.

thyrza(dot)ca

Ardene works in fashion and our family owns a chain of local music stores. We are young, creative professionals. Blaine is a musician and plays in a few local bands. Ardene is a personal stylist. We like to think of our family as laid back, easy going and welcoming. We love our community and believe Vancity to be one of the best cities in the world! We have travelled extensively internationally and enjoy fine food, music and art. 
Our family is super casual but with extremely busy lifestyles. We are independently employed and always on the go!
We are a Vancouver based family that is actually from here (rare!), living near Commercial drive. We look forward to welcoming you to our lovely city, or visiting you in yours.
I loved to travel. I am responsible, clean, tidy, non-smokers and love to meet new friends around the world.
We are a young family from Vancouver, Canada and have used airbnb with great success since 2011.

After living in France a few years ago I realized I would only stay in apartments during extended stays from then on. Travelling frequently I look for 4 star hotel qualities coupled with a reasonable rate in any accommodation. My own vacation rental, I hope, offers the same here in Vancouver. I put every effort in to outfit this studio with everything a stylish traveler needs. Extremely clean, great location, well appointed furnishings and wifi are at the top of my list and they will be the top of yours if you are looking to stay at DohmHome for a stay longer than 30 nights!
A Canadian found half the time in Colombia and half the time in Canada/Europe/Asia.  I travel a lot and have been to 60? 70? countries by now.

I'm a film and tv director from Vancouver, and my partner is a painter. We have a small hypo-allergenic dog (Dusty.) We love our neighbourhood, and rent our home while travelling or working elsewhere.

Lover of travel with a passion for finding the best spots to eat, drink, see a show, take in some music or commune with nature. As a former journalist and current communications geek I'm always interested in a good story. Travel has taught me big lessons about the world and myself. By hosting, I hope to return the hospitality I've received from so many; helping guests find the inside scoop on my neighbourhood and city of Vancouver; the place I always love coming home to.
Born in Australia and split my time between Vancouver and Whistler. Love cycling, my dog and meeting new people!

We lived in NYC for 20 years before moving to Vancouver.  We like to make things and value things that are made well and responsibly.  We hope you will feel this during our stay at our home.  (Update: We are now living in NYC.)

I am Angela and my friend's name is Gillian. We met through Airbnb and now became business partners and best friends. We both love design, art, music, travel, entertaining, fashion and food. We live in Kitsilano which is one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Vancouver right next to the ocean. It has a really welcoming and vibrant atmosphere. 

We've been using Airbnb since the beginning, staying with hosts and hosting people from around the world. 

We're both easy going and enjoy life to the full. We love to meet people from all walks of life and share our different cultural experiences.
I love to travel and explore my own city as well as warm and sunny destinations

(Website hidden by Airbnb) 

I just moved back to beautiful Vancouver, Canada. I spent 3 years in Asia and really missed the simple things in life: breathing fresh air, free clean water and clear skies. I play a variety of sports and believe that we are citizens of the world as the world goes through a digital transformation. I worked remotely in over 18 cities in 2016 and hope that I can host you and your stay!

My husband and I met while travelling (and studying) in Hong Kong back in 2004 - He was from the UK, and I was from Canada.  Since then, we've enjoyed travelling around the world, spent 7 years living in London and have now moved across the pond to try out life on the west coast, in Vancouver.

Hi,
I’m Valerie. Originally from Vienna, Austria, I now call Vancouver home where I live with my husband and two young children. I love traveling and hosting people, exploring the outdoors with my little ones, and spending time with family and friends.

We are local Vancouverites who loves to travel. In the past some of our best travel experiences have been discovering great spots recommended by friends around the globe. Vancouver is a great city and if you are looking for tips on where to go, what to see or what to eat let us know and we'll be more then happy to help out. 

Enjoy your Trip!

Professor School of Public Policy
Simon Fraser University
Vancouver, BC
Canada

Local Vancouverites who recently moved into a new house and we want to share a part of that space with you! We are clean and accommodating people who want to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

Born, raised and currently living in Seattle WA.

In terms of hosting and travelling... our motto is treat every guest as though they were a good friend of ours and treat every place we stay as if we were staying with a good friend of ours.

Most of my properties are related to my timeshare. I own several weeks/weekend that I rent out. Occasionally we rent out a room at our home in Seattle and our family home in Palm Desert, CA.

Our goal is to have several vacation properties we can use, share with friends and rent to communities like here on airbnb.

Looking forward to hosting you!

Travelling is the one time in life when you are truly in the moment, because you are experiencing everything for the first time. I am a musician and a teacher. I love to travel and have travelled extensively to five of the seven continents. When I travel, I enjoy experiencing the local culture, natural beauty and history of the area. I love good music, food, books and film. I am a self sufficient, respectful, and quiet guest. I do not smoke, drink or do drugs. Thank you for reading and I look forward to meeting you soon...
I am basically a Giant Panda Bear.
Hard worker, lover of travel, business and natural science.

My friends might describe me as outgoing, fun, (maybe a tad spontaneous) honest and trustworthy (or...gosh I hope they would!)   

I have traveled many times around the globe staying in many  wonderful and not-so-wonderful places over the years. The best parts have always been meeting people from many different places.  

With my feet planted firmly (finally my mother says...), I now love lending my home to people who want to explore this gorgeous city of ours - Vancouver.  

I'm here waiting to help with anything you need so please feel free to ask. 

Trish

When the Olympic games came to Vancouver in 2010, we heard that there was an accommodation shortage, and that people were going to be sleeping in their cars.  Thinking that this didn't sound very comfortable, we decided to open our home to visitors.  We discovered that we love to share our spectacular city, but also that our guests allow us to see our city from a new perspective.  We are constantly learning new things about Vancouver, and about the world through our international (and sometimes not-so-distant) visitors.  When the Olympics ended we decided to keep the spirit of hospitality going.

Kevin is a Marine Biologist, originally from Florida, who consults at the Vancouver Aquarium and also runs his own custom aquarium and maintenance business.  Usually in flip-flops, even in the winter, Kevin brings a sunny disposition from the warm south to Vancouver.  Kevin likes to balance adventure with relaxation, and to experience both urban and natural settings,  getting to know new places through their people, their food, and if possible, through diving! Favourite vacation spots for Kevin: Australian Outback, Great Barrier Reef, Franz Joseph Glacier in New Zealand, Seoraksan National Park in Korea, New York City, Kyoto.  His favourite spot to dive was the Whitsundays in Australia.

Patrick is an associate at a small, recognized architecture firm in Vancouver, where he keeps busy and loves his work.  Originally from Victoria, BC, on Vancouver Island, home is where the mountains meet the ocean.  Patrick is crazy about architecture and loves to learn about new places through their historical buildings.  The perfect vacation for Patrick fuses culture and relaxation. Favourite vacation spots for Patrick: Kyoto and Nara, the Meteora in Greece, Crete, Rome (the whole city, but especially the Pantheon), the baths at Caracalla in Italy, Venice, New York, the Oregon dunes, coastal California, Montreal, and anywhere in British Columbia where nature is unspoiled. 

Kevin and Patrick have both traveled around British Columbia extensively, so in addition to personalized recommendations for your Vancouver itinerary, they can also recommend short excursions around this stunning region.

We are a family of 5 who love to travel. Mom and the kids speak French and dad is a great musician. We are happy to share our homes with guests so they can experience this beautiful area of the world.

I have been an English language teacher for the past 17 years. I love my work as I have the privilege of helping and welcoming new immigrants to wonderful Canada. I love to travel and have had the good fortune to travel to many countries all over the world. We have just returned from a trip to Southeast Asia and loved it. We've been hosts for Airbnb many times and I think it's a great system. We've enjoyed meeting people from around the world and have had a very positive experience hosting them.

Vancouverite for now, but have lived in Toronto, Cambridge and Kenya. I teach Biology and Health Sciences at Langara College in Vancouver. I am a mother to 4 amazing children :-) I like to read, cook, garden, travel and teach. There are many more things I like to do but I am pretty busy at this period in my life. I also work on small scale community development in Kenya and travel there every 1-2 years. Oh yes, I am a student in Public Health as well!

My name is Ying Ying and I was originally born in Singapore. I moved to Canada (Richmond) with my family in 1990 and I love it!

I've been in Vancouver since I moved into my apartment in 2005. Vancouver is a wonderful city and I love sharing things about it to visitors and guests.

I started my own consulting business specializing in travel concierge and event planning/production. I also do social media consulting for individuals and small businesses, helping them figure out what social media means to them and how they can utilize it.

My style statement is Sophisticated Adventure, and that is how I want to live my life. There are many things I love but the #1 thing I would have to say I love is travel. If I win the lottery tomorrow, the first thing I would do after paying off my bills is to take off on a plane!

I look forward to hosting you at my apartment, and I look forward to meeting you when I travel!

I'm a chef and nutrition coach. 
Food is an important part of my life. For me, cooking is about connecting with loved ones, enjoying the earth's bounty, nurturing and healing our bodies.
I enjoy painting, traveling, walking on the beach, swimming, and yoga.

I am a young at heart mother of 3 girls. I love the outdoors, healthy food,  discovering beautiful, eclectic, off the beaten track kind of places, travelling anywhere in the world .
 I adore  animals, ( wolves in particular ), the natural world, gardening, being creative inventive, watercolours,  photography ,writing, knitting, cooking, riding my bike, swimming, walking long distances and hiking.  I'm a pretty good DIY ' er .
 My profession for the past 25 years till present has been in Landscape Design, before that I worked as a tree planter, a camp cook for mining exploration and treeplanting camps in northern parts of Canada companies ,once upon a time I was a Hairdresser and in another recent lifetime, co owner of an Outdoor Adventure company that took guests up to explore our precious BC coast and the Islands of Haida Gwaii by boat, other trips took us into the depths of Borneo  (1990 ) where our purpose was part adventure, part anti logging activism and exposure ... 
  I was born and raised in  ( East ) Vancouver, BC and  have worked and travelled all over Canada coast to coast, drove the west coastline from Vancouver to Guatemala, seen quite a bit of  USA, Borneo, Malaysia. The past few years I focussed on Great Britain, Eastern and western Europe, Turkey where I walked extensively in no particular direction  or destination, pretty much making it up as I went along , observing whatever crossed my path on that day . I’m a big fan of getting lost in old cities and finding my way back. 
 I love where I live, my home is a very old house with many mini ongoing fixer upper projects going on.
 I'm told it's “funky, comfortable, kind of wabi -sabi -shabby- chic- vintage-organic. “ 
 My house sits in a grove of magnolias which bloom pink in April within a Douglas fir forest and a bluebell meadow in May overlooking a peek a boo view of the city lights and north shore mountains from my yard.  
 I have lived in this same house for 28 years and counting!  
At this time we have our resident two mini -house lions/cats, Pip and Clementine (mother and daughter) .
I have a couple of functional bikes for guests to use during their stay. ( they are not electric )
 Cheers and welcome to my little home in the city forest, 
Anne
I’m currently a student studying in Vancouver, BC :)

I am a happy guy living in the most livable city in the world.  My wife and two boys and I are active cycling, hiking, camping  travelers.  We're very respectful of other people's privacy and property, as well, I hope that others are of mine. When travelling, I love living like a local in a new city.  It feels like I get to try being somebody new and I can see the city through the eyes of a local.  Often I get decorating or organization ideas from vacation rental decor.   My favourite places have always been by the water!

When hosting, I love hearing about other countries, customs, and cultures.  We host international students who live with us like family.  When they leave we long for the day to reconnect.  We have reconnected and stayed in touch with a great number of our students.  Hosting allows us to bring the world to us.

We are a French-American family with 3 children currently enjoying the Vancouver lifestyle, having recently relocated from Asia and Europe.

We have a passion for traveling - and have been fortunate to travel the world with our kids - often making other people's home our own, either with owner house rentals or home exchanges. Living in someone's home is not only the best option when traveling with kids, it is also a great way to meet people around the world and we have made many friends along the way.

Hello!

To my guests: I love hosting my apartment in Vancouver. I am an avid solo-traveler and it’s great to provide fellow travelers a chance to stay like a local. Airbnb has enriched my travel experiences, I've made some wonderful memories and friendships.

Message to hosts: I like to respect others places like my own or even better than my own. I love to experience different places, landscapes, nature, meet new people, taste local cuisine and maybe even get a feel of being a local. 

After several years as a freelance designer and project manager I am now a grad student studying architecture. Hi,

I, my 2 girls & our handsome 20 years old Siamese cat  live between  beautiful Vancouver & most gorgeous of all BC Salt Spring Island in  Canada. 


If not in Vancouver,  we are at my second home on Salt Spring Island right by the ocean in the quiet north east part of the island. I feel lucky to have found this gem. Truly  a piece of paradise.


 In Vancouver,  we live in one of those beautiful 100 +  years old Kitsilano Craftsman houses. I have lived in Kitsilano for over 20 years.  It has always been a great place to live as a single adult and also as a parent with kids. It is a very convenient  location for both living and visiting. My daughters are, one  16 years old & the other 10 years old .. and I am an Expressive Arts Therapist, Interior Stylist, dance & movement enthusiast & a mom with many projects going on! We love people & also music!  We play when we have the chance, so if you are a musician go ahead and play .. let us know if you want to jam! :)

As a guest, I am considerate, respectful and gracious. My friends would describe me as friendly, down to earth and sociable.

My name is Margaret. My husband and I live in East Vancouver with our children. We are both young professionals working as environmental consultants. Passionate about eternal travel (even here at home in beautiful British Columbia), I love getting off the beaten track, new friends, new foods, new experiences.

My partner and I love to travel and explore new places. We have hosted and been hosted on Airbnb many times; please see our positive reviews below. I am a writer and my wife is a videographer and photographer. We are both Canadian and are currently travelling full time for work and adventure.

Nearby you can walk to Rogers Arena or BC Place to experience NHL Hockey/ CFL Football/ MLS Soccer / or one of the many concerts that come to Vancouver.  The Seawall is walking distance we always suggest casual and fine dining restaurants in your area.  You are also close to movie theatres, Chinatown, Gastown, Science World, Museums, and shopping malls.  As a Host, we are available for you via the AirBnB Message Board or Email as a resource and our team know the local hot places to see and things to do - we want you to discover, experience, and enjoy Vancouver as we so love it! 

We would love Guests who are respectful, clean, honest, trustworthy, easy going and communicative. Please let us know how we can help you make your stay with us the most pleasant visit to Vancouver!

Hello, I am a designer that has lived in Vancouver's oldest and most entertaining/ interesting neighbourhood, Gastown, for 10 years.  The best restaurants, bars, shops, and design that Vancouver has to offer. I love art, music, design,  people and trying new things. When staying in other people's homes on Airbnb, I treat it how I'd like my home to be treated - with respect and appreciation. Please feel free to ask for dining/ sightseeing recommendations. This is a new listing through Airbnb however I have hosted other apartments in the past.

We love to travel, try new food and go on adventures! We love getting outdoors in our backyard around BC. We're excited to offer our suite to guests looking to explore Vancouver and are happy we can share our friendly neighbourhood. There's so much to do here and we love helping our awesome guests have a fantastic stay. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have questions and if you're coming to Vancouver, we'd love to host you! Happy exploring. :)
Ex Parisian, now living in Vancouver, Canada. Very outgoing and spontaneous . I love meditation, cycling, golf and being immersed in Nature. I am curious and love to travel the world.

We're a quiet, mature couple originally from Canada, currently in LA for the past three years, looking to relax, read, sightsee... and in most cases, take time to work on our writing projects outside of the City of Angels.

I love to call Vancouver home and am excited to host you! When I'm not busy working, I enjoy going on long sunset walks, surfing, and hiking the beautiful West Coast mountains. As an avid traveler that has lived and worked in various cities, I know how important a space is to come home to, and want to give you the best experience.

I am a friendly, kind, educated, helpful person. Some of my interests include; travel, languages, culture, foods etc. I absolutely love all animals and have 2 cats as roommates. I also really enjoy athletic pursuits and the outdoors. I have recently taken to road biking and am really enjoying this new sport. 

I like to have fun and despite being mature, so to speak, still enjoy social outings- dj's etc. I enjoy helping people and am pretty knowledgable about Vancouver and the Pacific Northwest in general (Seattle & Portland). 

I speak fluent Italian and can communicate in Spanish and French and a little in Japanese as well.

I am a young entrepreneur living in Vancouver, Canada. My family and I own/operate several hotels in BC included in the Okanagan and Vancouver Island so I would like to think we know a bit about great hosting and the hottest things to explore =)

I love to travel, golf, hike, shop, watch Netflix, meet new people, eat great food and be the best version of me I can be!

This is my second time owning an apartment in Vancouver and as everyone knows the cost of living in Vancouver is very high so I've decided to open my home to you amazing travellers to help cover some costs. 

I am an avid traveller and explorer myself. I love meeting new people and learning about their unique experiences and backgrounds. I also love to connect and help people explore the best version of Vancouver and Vancouver Island as possible as I truly believe it is one of the best areas in the world.

Like most airbnb hosts our requests are we don't treat this service as a hotel. Hotels will be better if all you need is a good bed and a room. Instead allow us to be ambassadors of our city to you. We want you to experience how local live through our homes in hopes of one day being able to experience the same in your cities!

Moreover, I am not doing this as a business but rather just a way to supplement housing expenses. Having said that I want to request that we treat our houses the way you will treat yours. 

Let us be respectful of neighbors the way you'll respect people living in your own homes.
Happy, Easy going and relaxed.
I love to travel and also love a beautiful place to stay.   In return, I offer my visitors a memorable stay in Vancouver!  Vancouver House is an amazing 5 star condo in the center of Vancouver.
Vancouver, Canada.  I'm a photographer work in marketing industry.

Professionally I work with youth ages 11 - 18 and have done so for over 25 years. James manages a local Indigenous tourism company and is a canoe guide (outdoor/adventure guiding).

We love to spend time travelling different places of the world and endeavour to understand the places we visit in a more meaningful way by meeting up with local people and experiencing life in these locations beyond the usual tourist track.

I love to travel myself, and have used Airbnb for a number of stays. I hope to be able to provide the same security and warmth as I have encountered numerous times. I won't be around, I'll be traveling. But I'll have a lockbox for your key and a local contact/manager to help manage your stay.

We’re an easy-going pair of nomadic foodie adventurers who’ve made Vancouver our home for most of the past decade. 
Tuba comes from Istanbul, Turkey, where she earned a degree in electrical and electronic engineering before being drawn to Vancouver’s digital visual effects industry. She worked at ILM and her recent credits include Ready Player One, A Wrinkle in Time, Skyscraper, Aquaman and recently  released Aladdin. She is currently working at Apple in Los Angeles. Ollie was born in Auckland, NZ, and got into the visual effects industry in his home country, choreographing virtual battle scenes on the Lord of the Rings trilogy. Since then he’s lived in such diverse cities as Tokyo, London, Munich and Havana. He only came to Vancouver to work on one film, but quickly fell in love with the city—and one of its inhabitants, in particular.

Because we’re a Kiwi and a Turkey, we jokingly call ourselves the “two flightless birds”. But flying is our favourite way to get places, with sailing a close second. Wherever we go, we love scuba diving, snowboarding, hiking, climbing and other adventure sports—almost as much as we love trying new and exciting foods.

The garden has been in my family since the year 1725, when the town of Casteldaccia was founded by my ancestors  
I grew up and played every summer with my brother and my cousins in this garden, at that time much larger. Many years later, also my children played in it every summer. Many of my fondest memories are connected to this garden
The house, built in 1965, was my first project after I graduated in Architecture! 
Every year I return with my family to this house and to Casteldaccia to restore my energy and get in touch with my roots.
For 10 years, during summer, I ran in the garden a ‘Scuolina’, a free Art School for the children of Casteldaccia and nearby towns, teaching drawing, painting and ceramics.
Now I love to share my house and Casteldaccia with my guests.

Although my career is my main focus I am always up for new and exciting adventures and would most likely try anything once...I guess you could say I'm a bit of a thrill seeker.   As an example, I went white water rafting last Summer and although you might not think that's scary try to imagine doing it as a person who doesn't know how to swim....I jumped off a cliff with a life-jacket on and still almost got washed away... Needless to say I survived and am now entertaining swimming lessons because of my love for being around water.

I have a busy social life outside work, but also enjoy quiet nights at home be it experimenting with cooking new cuisine, watching movies or simply enjoying music of which I enjoy all types.  I would say I'm a person of extremes, days off are often spent outdoors and staying active....after all Vancouver is incredibly versatile, an adult playground if you will.  There aren't many other cities I know of where you can hike and snowboard in the same day if you choose which is why I love living here.  I enjoy learning about different cultures and travelling which I have done a fair bit of and intend to (Website hidden by Airbnb) current bucket list includes Italy, Turkey and Greece. I am a participant in Philanthropy, a strong believer in humanity, I am committed to donating to local charities be it time or recourses and I have also been sponsoring a 10 year old boy from Laos now for 3 years. Watching him grow and learn, knowing I have made his life just a tiny bit easier has been an incredible journey in itself for me.

My life motto is "Balance" and I believe you always have to smile more than you cry, give more than what you take, and love more than you hate.

As a host, I'd like to make my guests feel as comfortable as they would at home and I believe It's the little things that matter. In return, I hope my guests would treat my place as good as they would their own home.

My goal is to be the best host possible and look forward to having you as my guest.

My husband Christian emigrated from France 40+ years ago, and I from Saskatchewan(LOL).   We love food and wine. He is an avid cyclist; I am a recreational one.  We took our first separate vacation(s) in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ; I took our daughters then aged 16 and 19 to NYC staying in our first airbnb in the Lower East Side.  He went on a cycling vacation with friends to Tucson, Arizona.  For 18 years we spent two weeks in the summer cycling as a family in Whistler, renting the same cabin (pre-airbnb)and for the past 14 years Christian and I have made an annual pilgrimage in June to Yellow Point Lodge on Vancouver Island, which is a summer camp for adults (no children or pets allowed, and NO internet reception!) At YPL we practise the triathlon of eat/read/sleep/repeat interspersed with cycling the country roads, kayaking, using the tree shower on warm days, and exploring the forest. 

Our most recent airbnb stays were in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) in Marseille, the Dordogne, and Brittany. Local bread, cheese, wine, foie gras, oysters and other shellfish = epicureal bliss.

My dream is to run a B&B in France (or the Okanagan), where Christian could organize cycling tours for people who love food and drink as much as we do. 

The novel I most enjoyed recently was All the Light We Cannot See.  I love NYC for the Brooklyn Bridge, the Staten Island ferry, TKTS, the museums, LES,the Tenement Museum,Magnolia Bakery. I love Portland for its food, craft beer, bike routes, parks, and Powell's Books. I love Seattle for its Zoo, Science Centre, SAM, Dale Chiuly (OK, Tacoma) great restaurants and great selection of wine and beer - my favourite weekend getaway, except for the exorbitant cost of parking downtown.  I love my neighbourhood of Riley Park, just off Main St. I am hooked on Netflix.

Because we prefer to stay in a pied-a-terre(airbnb or (Hidden by Airbnb) ) instead of a hotel while travelling for more than a weekend, and because we loved hosting homestay students for 10 years, we have decided to take the plunge and become airbnb hosts ourselves, now that our daughters have left home and we are empty nesters.

Please ask any questions you may have about our laneway and if there is anything I could do to make your stay better please ask and if I can’t fulfill your requests then I can usually find the the information or service you would like to access; such as cleaning service, restaurant advice, guide to local travel and destinations, private car hire, boat  / crewed chartered yacht hire, public transit, bike routes through the city or delivery services. I am very well traveled and have lived in many different countries throughout my lifetime, so I love meeting international people and getting to know their cultures and their stories.  Some of my favorite travel destinations include Sydney, Prague, and Hong Kong.  I am a music lover, and secretly moonlight as a singer/songwriter.

I live my life with a very positive mindset. It is not what happens to you in your life that dictates who you become, it is what you decide to do with what happens. Perspective is everything. 

I have been an entrepreneur for 9+ years. I enjoy traveling, hiking, meeting interesting people, eating good healthy food, snowboarding, spending time with my Family when I go back to Newfoundland and spending time with friends wherever I am. 

Fav Book would have to be The Way of The Peaceful Warrior. I like most music and most food that is not too spicy.

Professional, fun, active traveler living and working in Vancouver BC

I work for an international high school in Toronto and am completing a master’s program in counselling psychology at Simon Fraser University (SFU) in Vancouver. I love the outdoors - backpacking, hiking, travel, trail running and meeting new people!

I am Swiss-Canadian and certain that I've had the best of both these worlds instilled in me.  I am  easy-going, independent and adventurous as well as responsible and practical.   I am also curious, open-minded and respectful towards other people and try to learn as much as I can about cultures, customs and everyone's unique lives. 

I'm a non-smoker (and infrequent social drinker) and tend to prefer things  to be relaxing and quiet. 

I am very fortunate to have a job (in the non-profit sector) that I not only love, but also get to see the world with.  I have lived and worked abroad - in Switzerland, USA, Antarctica and Indonesia so very accustomed to sliding in and out of different cultures and customs.

My boyfriend Emmet and I share a beautiful one bedroom apartment in downtown Vancouver.  We both love to travel and are constantly planning our next adventure.  He is originally from Europe and we have often travel to visit his family and branched off to explore other areas of the continent from their home base.  Having lived out of suitcases on these trips, we know what it is like to be away from the comforts of home.

We like to keep things pretty minimalistic and that is reflected in our apartment - a beautiful, simple home.  We love to explore the world and our home city of Vancouver and can provide you with tips on what to see during your stay here.  

In my own travels I have both rented out my previous apartment and also rented accommodation in other cities, mostly using more primitive tools like (Hidden by Airbnb) to make this happen. Hurray for the emergence of Airbnb!

Last summer, Emmet and I went to Toronto and had a fantastic experience with an Airbnb there.  We really got a sense of what day-to-day life is like in the city. Right away I knew that I wanted to share our apartment to give others the opportunity to explore Vancouver like true Vancouverites.

So here we are with our bright and cozy home that we open to visitors when we are head off to travel.  We keep most of the basics stocked as we know what it is like to have to fit and carry things in your suitcase or go without. It is our goal to make you as comfortable in our home as you are in yours.  If you have any special requests or needs or just want more information, please don't hesitate to ask.

Happy travels and we hope to hear from you!

Vancouver is such a beautiful place, my unit is exceptionally wonderful and I want you to have the opportunity to enjoy it as well!

Hey :)

Situated in the heart of Olympic village and only minutes train ride from the downtown core, our home is surrounded with 360º views of Vancouver, encompassing the great North Shore Mountains all the way to Mt Baker while being easily accessible to restaurants and breweries.   It is the perfect little spot to spend a romantic getaway.

Vancouverite since 2000. Film teacher. Former art director and sculptor. Dog lover. Yoga teacher/practitioner. Happily married. Avid traveler. Host (since 2004) to longer-term travelers visiting Vancouver for work or play.

I'm an easy going, honest ,respectful guy. I work a lot of crazy hours and travel extensively to make up for working so much. I have a big passion for music, fashion the arts and above all enjoying life.

I travel extensively and my favourite aspect of travelling are the new people and friends I meet along the way. * I am obsessed with food (cooking and eating), and experiencing local cuisine is my favourite aspect of travelling!

My style of travelling is to "live like a local". I am clean, quiet, and respectful. I will treat your home as if it is my own.

My life motto is to live with a passion that inspires the mind, body, and soul.

It is such an alive beautiful city and has so much to offer and keep you entertained, throughout the entire stay, anytime of the year. You can actually ski/snowboard, play golf and have a picnic at the beach... ALL on the same day!

If you have transportation, there’s even more beautiful sites to visit in all four directions… outside of Vancouver.

North of Vancouver: 
Whistler/Blackcomb. World class skiing/boarding, mountain biking, golf courses, tennis, hiking....and much more. 

East of Vancouver:
Okanagan Valley. World class wineries and golf courses. 

West of Vancouver: 
The Gulf Islands. One of the worlds most scenic areas for Sailing/Boating/Whale watching and simply relaxing.

South of Vancouver: 
The Beautiful West Coast of the Untied States. (Washington State, Oregon State & California)

It is by far the most Beautiful Destination in the World and this  house has been completely renovated to help make your stay ... Perfect!

We are a family of 4 sharing the property with my parents - 3 generations together spanning the ages of 11- 83 years old. Amongst the group you will find a love of gardening, drawing, traveling, food (ask us about our favourite spots!) manga, reading, tinkering, cycling, walking, thrift shops, and general making of stuff. We can all safely say we have too many hobbies and don't slow down enough.
 
Tim and I, as architects and heritage aficionados, have spent the last 7+ years restoring our 1912 home while constructing a new carriage house at the back of the property for my parents. It continues to be a labour of love and a work in progress.

We’re seasoned Airbnb travelers, and are excited that our children are finally old enough to enjoy traveling as much as we do.  We hope to make our way to San Francisco when things become safe to do so. When we're traveling or my parents are off on adventures, our respectives homes become available for others to experience our great city.

For guests, we aim to find the right balance of being responsive to your needs, while also respecting your privacy during your stay.  We love our neighbourhood, feel lucky to live here, and look forward to sharing it with you!

I love to travel and have been to almost 40 countries, regularly Airbnb-ing with others. The best part is making new friends, sharing food and cultural experiences, and the unique long lasting memories that never fade. 

I also love to try new things (although I was more bold in my younger years!) and stay active with sports like volleyball and hiking. I am quite social but do like my down time too. 

I enjoy spending time with family and friends, but getting to know new people is fulfilling to me as well :)  Interactions with people energize me and I enjoy lending a helping hand anywhere I possibly can. 

Travel-wise, I can do it in style and pamper myself or throw on a backpack, stay in shared spaces and hang out wherever the locals do! 

As a host, I will do my utmost to make your stay a 5-star one. Please be in communication with me around how I can best do that. I believe in superb customer service and long-standing relationships. I also know gorgeous Vancouver quite well and can make recommendations as you desire!

"If you help enough people get what they want, you can have everything you want." Words I live by. 

I was raised in very small town where I learned early on, the importance of relationships and community, and I have carried this focus with me throughout my life.  My true passion is to make the lives around me better, whether by being a support system for my family, volunteering regularly at the local Homeless Shelter or by providing true service and value to my Real Estate clients. Making others happy is what makes me happy... that... and organizing. I love to structure and organize pretty much anything! 

When I'm not working or spending quality time with my family at the ski hill, soccer fields, or baseball fields (we have two very active teenagers who keep us busy),  I'm often found in the gym, on my mountain bike, reading, playing the piano or speaking at/ hosting events. 

One strange thing I simply can't live without... my journal... it's right up there with chocolate and coffee. :)

A  little about me….
I have been a practicing Art Educator for almost 20 years touring children from grade 1 to 12 at the Vancouver Art Gallery.  This practice allows me to explore art tradition, passion and execution with others in a traditional art gallery setting in a non-constrained open dialogue.  The sharing component of pairing art and education has brought much joy to my life.

The Eastside Culture Crawl Society has provided a greater view of expanding my art knowledge during the more than 10 years I have devoted to the organization.  It has been a pleasure to serve on the Board of the ECCS and Chair for 2 years as well as be the founder of the children's program Studio 101.  Also it was a pleasure to Chair the Space Committee and then continue to serve on that Committee.  It is very exciting to see the ECCS move the artist studio practice forward into becoming Vancouver's Eastside Art District.  What a pleasure it is play a role in that becoming a reality.

Over the last 20 years it has been my passion to personally grow through creating an art collection of local and international talent in the visual art field.  I'd have to say part of the fun of being a “small 'C'” collector, as I refer to myself, is the unexpected things you learn about yourself as you learn about art. As an art collector I love exploring these discoveries with others and sharing stories.
